cards.text: U

cards.name: Island
cards.text: U

cards.name: Island
cards.text: U

cards.name: Ivy Dancer
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Her ivy locks are a remnant of the wooded wilds now lost to Ravnica forever.

cards.name: Junktroller
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)

{T}: Put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: One man's trash is another man's troller.

cards.name: Keening Banshee
cards.text:
Flying

When Keening Banshee enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Her cold wail echoes in the alleys and under-eaves, finding the unfortunate and turning their blood to ice.

cards.name: Last Gasp
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Allow me a moment to catch your breath."

cards.name: Leashling
cards.text: Put a card from your hand on top of your library: Return Leashling to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Constructed of leather and irony.

cards.name: Leave No Trace
cards.text: Radiance — Destroy target enchantment and each other enchantment that shares a color with it.
cards.flavor: The magic of the Boros patrols the streets even when their soldiers do not.

cards.name: Life from the Loam
cards.text:
Return up to three target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.

Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.name: Light of Sanction
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures you control by sources you control.
cards.flavor: The Legion looks after its own.

cards.name: Lightning Helix
cards.text: Lightning Helix deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Though less well-known than its army of soldiers, the Boros Legion's mage-priests are as respected by the innocent as they are hated by the ghosts of the guilty.

rulings.text: If the creature or player is an illegal target as Lightning Helix tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

cards.name: Lore Broker
cards.text: {T}: Each player draws a card, then discards a card.
cards.flavor: Lies are sold as often as truths—and used just as effectively.

cards.name: Loxodon Gatekeeper
cards.text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: The gatekeepers are so fastidious that even the winds must wait to pass.

cards.name: Loxodon Hierarch
cards.text:
When Loxodon Hierarch enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

{G}{W}, Sacrifice Loxodon Hierarch: Regenerate each creature you control.
cards.flavor: "I have lived long, and I remember how this city once was. If my death serves to bring back the Ravnica in my memory, then so be it."

rulings.text: The second ability sets up individual regeneration shields for each creature you control. They are each used up as necessary during the turn and wear off when the turn ends.

cards.name: Lurking Informant
cards.text:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)

{2}, {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: In the undercity, forgetfulness is often encouraged at the point of a blade.

cards.name: Mark of Eviction
cards.text:
Enchant creature

At the beginning of your upkeep, return enchanted creature and all Auras attached to that creature to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: Tharashk the Bold suddenly wasn't himself. Or anyone else, for that matter.

cards.name: Master Warcraft
cards.text:
Cast Master Warcraft only before attackers are declared.

You choose which creatures attack this turn.

You choose which creatures block this turn and how those creatures block.

rulings.text: You choose attackers and make blocking assignments regardless of whether it's your turn and regardless of whether the creatures are attacking you. Your choices must be legal within the normal rules for attacking and blocking.
You can decide that a creature won't block.

If the defending player controls a planeswalker, the person who cast Master Warcraft first chooses the complete group of creatures that are going to attack. Then, for each of those creatures, the active player chooses who or what it's going to attack.

cards.name: Mausoleum Turnkey
cards.text: When Mausoleum Turnkey enters the battlefield, return target creature card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: When he reaches for his key ring, you should be running for the exit.

cards.name: Mindleech Mass
cards.text:
Trample

Whenever Mindleech Mass deals combat damage to a player, you may look at that player's hand. If you do, you may cast a nonland card in it without paying that card's mana cost.

rulings.text: The spell is cast during the resolution of Mindleech Mass's triggered ability. You may cast any nonland card in the player's hand, not just an instant card. This doesn't get around other prohibitions, such as "Cast this card only before attackers are declared."
You control the spell and, if it's an artifact, creature, or enchantment spell, you control the resulting permanent.
The card is cast from your opponent's hand, not yours.
You choose modes, pay additional costs, choose targets, etc. for the spell as normal when casting it. Any X in the mana cost will be 0. Alternative costs can't be paid.

cards.name: Mindmoil
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, put the cards in your hand on the bottom of your library in any order, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor:
"My criticism of the Izzet is that their impulse for learning seems too much like impulse and too little like learning."

—Trigori, Azorius senator

rulings.text: Whenever you cast a spell, Mindmoil's ability triggers. The ability will resolve before the spell does.
After Mindmoil's ability triggers, players may cast instants and activate activated abilities. Each time you cast an instant spell "in response," Mindmoil's ability triggers again.
After Mindmoil's ability resolves, but before the spell that triggered it does, you can cast instants from your new hand of cards. Each time you do, Mindmoil's ability triggers again.

cards.name: Mnemonic Nexus
cards.text: Each player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.
cards.flavor: True enlightenment comes not with a new thought, but with understanding of all the old ones.

cards.name: Moldervine Cloak
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.name: Molten Sentry
cards.text: As Molten Sentry enters the battlefield, flip a coin. If the coin comes up heads, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 5/2 creature with haste. If it comes up tails, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 2/5 creature with defender.
cards.flavor: Some take after their father, Stone, some after their mother, Fire.

rulings.text: If a creature enters the battlefield copying Molten Sentry, that creature's controller flips a coin to see what the copy will be.
If a creature that's already on the battlefield copies Molten Sentry, it becomes a copy of whatever Molten Sentry already is (either a 5/2 creature with haste or a 2/5 creature with defender).

cards.name: Moonlight Bargain
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. For each card, put that card into your graveyard unless you pay 2 life. Then put the rest into your hand.
cards.flavor: At every fifth full moon, the Moon Market convenes to peddle Ravnica's most forbidden wares.

cards.name: Moroii
cards.text:
Flying

At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Touched by moroii"

—Undercity slang meaning "to grow old"

cards.name: Mortipede
cards.text: {2}{G}: All creatures able to block Mortipede this turn do so.
cards.flavor: Mortipede pheromones choke the streets with sickly sweetness, luring the rash and unwary into its waiting jaws.

cards.name: Muddle the Mixture
cards.text:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell.

Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Necromantic Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: The target is chosen just after any creatures dealt lethal damage at the same time that the enchanted creature dealt damage have been put into the graveyard. That might include the enchanted creature itself, if it had trample and was blocked, for example.

cards.name: Necroplasm
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Necroplasm.

At the beginning of your end step, destroy each creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Necroplasm.

Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.name: Netherborn Phalanx
cards.text:
When Netherborn Phalanx enters the battlefield, each opponent loses 1 life for each creature he or she controls.

Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Nightguard Patrol
cards.text: First strike, vigilance
cards.flavor: "The Wojek defend the laws. We defend the people."

cards.name: Nightmare Void
cards.text:
Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.name: Nullmage Shepherd
cards.text: Tap four untapped creatures you control: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: The shepherds work in secret, seeking out abominations against nature and returning them to earth and dust.

cards.name: Nullstone Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying

Whenever the first noncreature spell of a turn is cast, counter that spell.
cards.flavor: Nullstone absorbs and dampens most forms of magical energy, as well as light, sound, and heat.

rulings.text: Nullstone Gargoyle cares about the first noncreature spell cast during a turn, not the first one it "sees." If a noncreature spell was cast before Nullstone Gargoyle entered the battlefield, it won't counter the next one.
If another spell is cast in response to the first spell, Nullstone Gargoyle doesn't affect that second spell.

cards.name: Oathsworn Giant
cards.text:
Vigilance

Other creatures you control get +0/+2 and have vigilance.
cards.flavor: The town stands on his ancestors' former burial grounds. Even with the graves long gone, he continues his determined vigil.

cards.name: Ordruun Commando
cards.text: {W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ordruun Commando this turn.
cards.flavor: Thick of muscle, stout of heart, and possessing a burning love of justice and the battlefield, the Ordruun minotaurs are the foundation of the Boros Legion.

cards.name: Overgrown Tomb
cards.text:
({T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.)

As Overgrown Tomb enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Overgrown Tomb enters the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Has basic land types, but isn't a basic land.  Things that affect basic lands don't affect it.  For example, you can't find it with Civic Wayfinder.
If another effect (such as Loxodon Gatekeeper's ability) tells you to put lands onto the battlefield tapped, it enters the battlefield tapped whether you pay 2 life or not.

If multiple permanents with "as enters the battlefield" effects are entering the battlefield at the same time, process those effects one at a time, then put the permanents onto the battlefield all at once. For example, if you're at 3 life and an effect puts two of these onto the battlefield, you can pay 2 life for only one of them, not both.

cards.name: Overwhelm
cards.text:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while casting this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)

Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Let the song of Selesnya be heard above the rhythm of our thundering hordes"

cards.name: Pariah's Shield
cards.text:
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to equipped creature instead.

Equip {3}
cards.flavor: To bear the shield of the pariah is the highest honor a Boros can receive—and the last.

rulings.text: If Pariah's Shield isn't attached to a creature, all damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to you normally.

cards.name: Peel from Reality
cards.text: Return target creature you control and target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: When House Dimir's secrets are in danger of exposure, the guild takes drastic measures to cover its tracks.

cards.name: Peregrine Mask
cards.text:
Equipped creature has defender, flying, and first strike.

Equip {2}
cards.flavor: The mask confers both the prowess of a falcon and its loyalty.

cards.name: Perilous Forays
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for a land card with a basic land type and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"This is the place? This map has got to be wrong . . . ."

—Svania Trul, wayfinder novice, last words

rulings.text: You may find any card with Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest on its type line. The land doesn't need to be a basic land, so you can find a land such as Overgrown Tomb or Tropical Island.

cards.name: Perplex
cards.text:
Counter target spell unless its controller discards his or her hand.

Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

rulings.text: If the spell's controller has no cards in his or her hand, that player can still choose to discard his or her hand and prevent the spell from being countered.

cards.name: Phytohydra
cards.text: If damage would be dealt to Phytohydra, put that many +1/+1 counters on it instead.
cards.flavor:
"Look at this creature, so like the Conclave it serves. Cut one head and it grows two. Damage it and it flourishes."

—Veszka, Selesnya evangel

rulings.text: If another effect would prevent damage from being dealt to Phytohydra or replace it with something else, Phytohydra's controller chooses which effect to apply first.

If Phytohydra blocks or is blocked by a creature with first strike or double strike, Phytohydra will get the counters during the first-strike combat damage step before it deals its own combat damage during the second combat damage step.

cards.name: Plague Boiler
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a plague counter on Plague Boiler.

{1}{B}{G}: Put a plague counter on Plague Boiler or remove a plague counter from it.

When Plague Boiler has three or more plague counters on it, sacrifice it. If you do, destroy all nonland permanents.

rulings.text: You choose whether to add or remove a counter when the second ability resolves. You can't choose to remove a counter if there isn't one there.

If the third ability triggers, removing a counter in response won't stop the effect. However, somehow removing Plague Boiler from the battlefield in response would stop the effect because then you wouldn't be able to sacrifice Plague Boiler.
The sacrifice is done on resolution of the triggered ability.

cards.name: Plains
cards.text: W

cards.name: Plains
cards.text: W

cards.name: Plains
cards.text: W

cards.name: Plains
cards.text: W

cards.name: Pollenbright Wings
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has flying.

Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, put that many 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Primordial Sage
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: For each creature that arrives in its audience, the sage imparts another piece of ancient wisdom for all to hear.

cards.name: Privileged Position
cards.text:
({G/W} can be paid with either {G} or {W}.)

Other permanents you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Psychic Drain
cards.text: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard and you gain X life.
cards.flavor:
"Gold can be reearned, goods restored. The moroii steal youth, more precious than either, and once gone, it's gone forever."

—Berta Suszat, civic healer

cards.name: Putrefy
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"All matter, animate or not, rots when exposed to time. We merely speed up the process."

—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

rulings.text: This spell isn't Modal.  When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an artifact, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

cards.name: Quickchange
cards.text:
Target creature becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.

Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Most Ravnicans lead lives of desperate survival. Those who thrive are malleable enough to change with the ever-shifting politics of the guilds.

rulings.text: You can choose any single color or any combination of more than one color. You can't choose colorless.
Quickchange won't make an artifact stop being an artifact. It'll just be a colorful artifact.

cards.name: Rain of Embers
cards.text: Rain of Embers deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: There's plenty to talk about in the marketplaces of Ravnica, be it the latest feud between guilds or the terrible weather.

cards.name: Rally the Righteous
cards.text: Radiance — Untap target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it. Those creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Yuri took up the ragged Boros banner, and his brethren, inspired by the act, followed him back into the fight.

cards.name: Razia's Purification
cards.text: Each player chooses three permanents he or she controls, then sacrifices the rest.
cards.flavor: Only the chosen ones are spared.

rulings.text: If a player doesn't control three permanents, that player chooses all the permanents he or she does control and doesn't sacrifice anything.
Players choose permanents in turn order around the table, then simultaneously sacrifice all permanents not chosen.

cards.name: Razia, Boros Archangel
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, haste

{T}: The next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control this turn is dealt to another target creature instead.
cards.flavor: Her sword burns with such brightness that foes avert their eyes and arrows divert their paths.

rulings.text: The 3 damage doesn't have to be from the same source, and it doesn't have to be all dealt at once. If only 2 damage is redirected, the next 1 damage will also be redirected.
If either target creature leaves the battlefield before damage is dealt, that damage won't be redirected. It doesn't matter if Razia leaves the battlefield.

cards.name: Recollect
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."

—Savra

cards.name: Remand
cards.text:
Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it into its owner's hand instead of into that player's graveyard.

Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Well, at least all of that arm-waving and arcane babbling you did was impressive."

rulings.text: The countered spell goes to its owner's hand from the stack. It never hits the graveyard.
If you Remand a card with Flashback, the card will still be exiled.

cards.name: Reroute
cards.text:
Change the target of target activated ability with a single target. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Three hundred years of practice thwarted by an instant of mischief.

cards.name: Ribbons of Night
cards.text: Ribbons of Night deals 4 damage to target creature and you gain 4 life. If {U} was spent to cast Ribbons of Night, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"My favorite meal is angel's flesh, slain in agony and iced with black vinegar."

—Aszala of House Dimir

cards.name: Rolling Spoil
cards.text: Destroy target land. If {B} was spent to cast Rolling Spoil, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The shadow that fell over the grove was silent yet horribly alive, roiling with millions of tiny minions dedicated to the process of rot.

cards.name: Roofstalker Wight
cards.text: {1}{U}: Roofstalker Wight gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: No heartbeat to hear, no greed to bribe, no fear of death.

cards.name: Root-Kin Ally
cards.text:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while casting this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)

Tap two untapped creatures you control: Root-Kin Ally gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sabertooth Alley Cat
cards.text:
Sabertooth Alley Cat attacks each turn if able.

{1}{R}: Creatures without defender can't block Sabertooth Alley Cat this turn.
cards.flavor: It has eight lives' worth of hunger to satisfy.

cards.name: Sacred Foundry
cards.text:
({T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.)

As Sacred Foundry enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Sacred Foundry enters the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Has basic land types, but isn't a basic land.  Things that affect basic lands don't affect it.  For example, you can't find it with Civic Wayfinder.
If another effect (such as Loxodon Gatekeeper's ability) tells you to put lands onto the battlefield tapped, it enters the battlefield tapped whether you pay 2 life or not.

If multiple permanents with "as enters the battlefield" effects are entering the battlefield at the same time, process those effects one at a time, then put the permanents onto the battlefield all at once. For example, if you're at 3 life and an effect puts two of these onto the battlefield, you can pay 2 life for only one of them, not both.

cards.name: Sadistic Augermage
cards.text: When Sadistic Augermage dies, each player puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.
cards.flavor: "Don't worry. I know the drill."

cards.name: Sandsower
cards.text: Tap three untapped creatures you control: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: It drifts through the streets as a breeze of collective sighs, wilting the bustle with dreams and heavy eyelids.

rulings.text: Because the cost of Sandsower's ability doesn't include the {T} symbol, you can tap any three untapped creatures you control (including Sandsower itself), even if those creatures haven't been under your control continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.

cards.name: Savra, Queen of the Golgari
cards.text:
Whenever you sacrifice a black creature, you may pay 2 life. If you do, each other player sacrifices a creature.

Whenever you sacrifice a green creature, you may gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Nature's most raw beauty is the circle: perfect in its continuance, with no break between death and life."

rulings.text: These abilities trigger specifically when you "sacrifice" a creature. They won't trigger when a creature is put into your graveyard for any other reason.
Savra itself doesn't let you sacrifice creatures, and you can't sacrifice them spontaneously. You must have another spell or ability that lets you sacrifice creatures.
Sacrificing a creature that's both black and green will make both abilities trigger. You may put them on the stack in whichever order you want.

cards.name: Scatter the Seeds
cards.text:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while casting this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)

Put three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: From the seeds of faith, great forests grow.

cards.name: Scion of the Wild
cards.text: Scion of the Wild's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor: It has a hundred thousand extinctions to avenge.

cards.name: Screeching Griffin
cards.text:
Flying

{R}: Target creature can't block Screeching Griffin this turn.
cards.flavor: They were master fishers, but their seas are now the streets and their catch, the goblins that run pell-mell from the screeching in the sky.

cards.name: Searing Meditation
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {2}. If you do, Searing Meditation deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"When I meditate I see the world as it should be. All that does not fit, I remove."

—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

rulings.text: Searing Meditation doesn't care how much life you gain. It triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it's 1 life from Firemane Angel or 15 life from Brightflame.

cards.name: Seed Spark
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If {G} was spent to cast Seed Spark, put two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"If you ask me, those root-lovers value mindless dogma over progress."

—Trivaz, Izzet mage

cards.name: Seeds of Strength
cards.text:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Beneath the beauty of light and seed is the might of Vitu-Ghazi.

rulings.text: You may choose the same creature as a target multiple times since the card says "target creature" multiple times. You may give three different creatures +1/+1 each, one creature +2/+2 and another creature +1/+1, or a single creature +3/+3.

cards.name: Seismic Spike
cards.text: Destroy target land. Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Natural disasters in Ravnica are largely nullified by the Izzet. Unnatural disasters, on the other hand, happen all of the time.

cards.name: Selesnya Evangel
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "The clamor of the city drowns all voices. But together we can sing a harmony that will resonate from Ravnica's tallest spires to her deepest wells."

cards.name: Selesnya Guildmage
cards.text:
{3}{G}: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

{3}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Selesnya Sagittars
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

Selesnya Sagittars can block an additional creature.
cards.flavor:
"What's their strike range, you ask? Let's put it this way: sagittars aim their bows using maps."

—Otak, Tin Street shopkeep

cards.name: Selesnya Sanctuary
cards.text:
Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield tapped.

When Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

{T}: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.name: Selesnya Signet
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: The symbol of the Conclave is one of unity, with tree supporting sun and sun feeding tree.

cards.name: Sell-Sword Brute
cards.text: When Sell-Sword Brute dies, it deals 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor: "Killing is easy. Just wrap your hand around the haft, and wrap your enemy around the blade."

cards.name: Sewerdreg
cards.text:
Swampwalk

Sacrifice Sewerdreg: Exile target card from a graveyard.
cards.flavor: They hardly have form, dripping through pipe and grate with the slip and stench of flowing sewage.

cards.name: Shadow of Doubt
cards.text:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)

Players can't search libraries this turn.

Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Your ignorance is my bliss."

—Szadek

rulings.text: If an effect says "You may search your library . . . If you do, shuffle your library," you can't choose to search since it's impossible, and you won't shuffle.
If an effect says "Search your library . . . Then shuffle your library," the search effect fails, but you will have to shuffle.

Since players can't search, players won't be able to find any cards in a library. The effect applies to all players and all libraries. If a spell or ability's effect has other parts that don't depend on searching for or finding cards, they will still work normally.
Effects that tell a player to reveal cards from a library or look at cards from the top of a library will still work. Only effects that use the word "search" will fail.

cards.name: Shambling Shell
cards.text:
Sacrifice Shambling Shell: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Shred Memory
cards.text:
Exile up to four target cards from a single graveyard.

Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Siege Wurm
cards.text:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while casting this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)

Trample
cards.flavor: The Rubblefield was once among the wealthiest districts in Ravnica. All it took was a single wurm to reduce it to ruins.

cards.name: Sins of the Past
cards.text: Until end of turn, you may cast target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that card would be put into your graveyard this turn, exile it instead. Exile Sins of the Past.

rulings.text: The instant or sorcery card is cast from your graveyard, not your hand. You choose modes, pay additional costs, choose targets, etc. for the spell as normal when casting it. Any X in the mana cost will be 0. Alternative costs can't be paid.
The instant or sorcery card never gets put back into your graveyard, even if it's countered. You can't cast it more than once.

cards.name: Sisters of Stone Death
cards.text:
{G}: Target creature blocks Sisters of Stone Death this turn if able.

{B}{G}: Exile target creature blocking or blocked by Sisters of Stone Death.

{2}{B}: Put a creature card exiled with Sisters of Stone Death onto the battlefield under your control.

rulings.text: The second ability can only exile a creature that's currently blocking or being blocked by Sisters of Stone Death. If Sisters of Stone Death isn't on the battlefield or have been removed from combat, the ability will be countered.

The third ability can get back any creature card exiled by the second ability, no matter when it was exiled. If a card that's not a creature card (such as Svogthos, the Restless Tomb) was exiled, the third ability can't return it.

cards.name: Skyknight Legionnaire
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor:
"I do not know which gives me more pride: the legions of soldiers marching in thunderous lockstep, or the cry of the skyknights riding their rocs like jagged lightning overhead."

—Razia

cards.name: Smash
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.

Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Ravnica's laws protect not its citizens but its industry. Aging equipment is destroyed rather than restored, to bring more money into the factories' coffers.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The irritable drakes are solitary nesters. Even brooding females barely contain the urge to attack their own young.

cards.name: Sparkmage Apprentice
cards.text: When Sparkmage Apprentice enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Pajik was amazed and pleased at his newfound powers. His pet cat Rivin was slightly less enthusiastic.

cards.name: Spawnbroker
cards.text: When Spawnbroker enters the battlefield, you may exchange control of target creature you control and target creature with power less than or equal to that creature's power an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "The trick isn't setting up the bad trade. It's making each side think it got the better deal."

rulings.text: If either target becomes illegal (say, if a creature's power has changed such that the creature you control now has less power than the other creature), then the exchange won't happen.

cards.name: Spectral Searchlight
cards.text: {T}: Choose a player. That player adds one mana of any color he or she chooses to his or her mana pool.
cards.flavor: The first searchlights were given as gifts, symbols of cooperation, to the emissaries present at the signing of the Guildpact.

rulings.text: You may choose yourself.

cards.name: Stasis Cell
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

{3}{U}: Attach Stasis Cell to target creature.
cards.flavor: The Simic created the cells to preserve their experiments. The Azorius put the cells to use on the guilty.

cards.name: Stinkweed Imp
cards.text:
Flying

Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.

Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.
Notably, Stinkweed Imp's ability isn't deathtouch. It's a triggered ability that triggers only on combat damage.

The card is cast from your library, not your hand. You choose modes, pay additional costs, choose targets, etc. for the spell as normal when casting it. Any X in the mana cost will be 0. Alternative costs can't be paid.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{3}{B}{G}: Until end of turn, Svogthos, the Restless Tomb becomes a black and green Plant Zombie creature with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard." It's still a land.

rulings.text: While animated, Svogthos's power and toughness changes each time a creature card enters or leaves its controller's graveyard.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

rulings.text: If the named card is found, everything from the top of the library down to the named card is put into the graveyard and the library isn't shuffled. If the named card isn't in the library, no cards are put into the graveyard and the library is shuffled.

rulings.text: The first ability only cares that creature tokens leave the battlefield. It doesn't matter where they went.

cards.name: Vulturous Zombie

rulings.text: The ability doesn't care why a card goes to your opponent's graveyard -- only that it does. The ability triggers when a card is put into your opponent's graveyard from the stack (a spell resolves or is countered), from the battlefield (a permanent is destroyed or sacrificed), from the player's hand (a card is discarded), from the player's library (from a Millstone-like effect), or from any other zone.

cards.name: War-Torch Goblin

cards.name: Warp World
cards.text: Each player shuffles all permanents he or she owns into his or her library, then reveals that many cards from the top of his or her library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of his or her library.

rulings.text: Anything that triggers during the resolution of this will wait to be put on the stack until everything is put onto the battlefield and resolution is complete. The player whose turn it is will put all of his or her triggered abilities on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order will do the same. (The last ability put on the stack will be the first one that resolves.)

Taking it slowly, here's what happens when Warp World resolves:
1) Each player counts the number of permanents he or she owns.
2) Each player shuffles those permanents into his or her library.
3) Each player reveals cards from the top of his or her library equal to the number that player counted.
4) Each player puts all artifact, land, and creature cards revealed this way onto the battlefield. All of these cards enter the battlefield at the same time.
5) Each player puts all enchantment cards revealed this way onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way can enchant an artifact, land, or creature that was already put onto the battlefield, but can't enchant an enchantment that's being put onto the battlefield at the same time as it. If multiple players have Auras to put onto the battlefield, the player whose turn it is announces what his or her Auras will enchant, then each other player in turn order does the same, then all enchantments (both Auras and non-Auras) enter the battlefield at the same time.
6) Each player puts all of his or her other revealed cards (instants, sorceries, planeswalkers, and Auras that can't enchant anything) on the bottom of his or her library in any order.

Tokens are permanents but not cards. They'll count toward the number of permanents shuffled into your library, so you'll get a card back for each token you owned. But the tokens themselves should be ignored while you're revealing *cards* from your library. In practice, you shouldn't actually shuffle them into your library since they'll cease to exist as soon as Warp World finishes resolving. Note that a token's owner is the player under whose control it first entered the battlefield; this is a change from previous rules.

Flying

Flying

cards.name: Wojek Embermage

cards.flavor: "Your brother's crimes are your crimes. You stood by and lent support, so you too must face judgment."

rulings.text: The effect has no stated duration, so a land turned into a creature this way continues being a creature as long as the land is on the battlefield.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.
